definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: The verandah in front of our building had large drums set up for use as barbecue grills.
sentences.chinese: 旅館前的走廊上支起了好幾面大鼓，可以用來燒烤。

sentences.english: People like to boast is like a big drum, make the greatest sound very empty.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡吹噓的人猶如一面大鼓，響聲大腹中空。

sentences.english: Listen! The torn-torn is playing. How energetic I am!
sentences.chinese: 聽大鼓在演奏，我精神多抖擻。

sentences.english: Stilt-walking, drumming and dragon and lion dancing are the main entertainment forms of the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 踩高蹺，敲大鼓和舞龍獅也是元宵節主要的娛樂活動。

sentences.english: Big drum is a kind of Jino sacred sacrificial utensil and musical instrument.
sentences.chinese: 大鼓是基諾族神聖的祭器和樂器。

sentences.english: Wooden strips alone the big drum represent sunshine. So Jino's big drum is also called Jino Sun Drum.
sentences.chinese: 大鼓邊沿的小木條象徵太陽光芒，因此又稱太陽鼓。

definition: waist drum/waist-drum dance (Han ethnic group folk dance)
Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
watchman's clapper/wooden clappers with bars of unequal length
percussion instrument in the form of a bamboo fish (traditionally used by Daoist priests)
